1{-# LANGUAGE FlexibleContexts #-}
2{-# LANGUAGE OverloadedStrings #-}
3{-# LANGUAGE ViewPatterns #-}
4{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
5
6-- | Text enclosed in angle brackets.
7
8module Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Symbol.AngleText
9  ( -- * Functions
10    angleQuote,
11    angleTexts,
12    -- * Keyword table
13    -- $Table
14  ) where
15
16import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture     as O
17
18-- | Convert string into double-quoted and angle-quoted form.
19--
20--   >>> putStrLn $ angleQuote "aaa"
21--   "aaa"
22--
23--   >>> putStrLn $ angleQuote "\t"
24--   <tab>
25--
26--   >>> putStrLn $ angleQuote "aaa\nbbb\r\nccc\r\n\r\nddd"
27--   "aaa" <lf> "bbb" <crlf> "ccc" <crlf> <crlf> "ddd"
28--
29angleQuote :: (O.Textual t) => t -> t
30angleQuote = O.tJoinWith " " . angleList
31
32{-| Divdie text into angle (Left) and non-angle (Right) subtexts.
33
34    >>> angleList "foo\r\nbar\n\n\"baz\""
35    ["\"foo\"", "<crlf>", "\"bar\"", "<lf>", "<lf>", "<qq>", "\"baz\"", "<qq>"]
36    -}
37angleList :: (O.Textual t) => t -> [t]
38angleList = loop where
39    loop t | O.tIsEmpty t = []
40           | otherwise    = case O.span nonAngle t of
41                              (a, b) | O.tIsEmpty b -> [non a]
42                                     | O.tIsEmpty a ->         angle b
43                                     | otherwise    -> non a : angle b
44
45    non t = '"' O.<:> (t O.++ "\"")
46
47    angle (O.cut -> O.Jp c t)
48        = case O.majorGeneralCategory c of
49            O.UnicodePunctuation -> punct c t
50            O.UnicodeOther       -> other c t
51            _                    -> char c t
52    angle _ = []
53
54    punct '"' t                = "<qq>" : loop t
55    punct c   t                = char c t
56
57    other '\r' t               = cr t
58    other '\n' t               = "<lf>"  : loop t
59    other '\t' t               = "<tab>" : loop t
60    other c    t               = char c t
61
62    cr (O.cut -> O.Jp '\n' t)  = "<crlf>" : loop t
63    cr t                       = "<cr>"   : loop t
64
65    char c t                   = angleChar c : loop t
66
67{-| Test non-angle character.
68
69    >>> nonAngle <$> "foo\r\nbar\"baz"
70    [True,True,True,False,False,True,True,True,False,True,True,True]
71    -}
72nonAngle :: Char -> Bool
73nonAngle c =
74    case O.majorGeneralCategory c of
75      O.UnicodePunctuation -> c /= '"'
76      O.UnicodeOther       -> False
77      _                    -> True
78
79-- | Angle text of the Unicode code point.
80--
81--   >>> angleChar 'K' :: String
82--   "<U+4B>"
83--
84angleChar :: (O.Textual t) => Char -> t
85angleChar c = "<U+" O.++ O.intUpperHexString (fromEnum c) O.++ ">"
86
87-- | Table of coresspondences of angle text and its replacement.
88--
89--   >>> lookup "lf" angleTexts
90--   Just "\n"
91--
92angleTexts :: (O.Textual t) => [(t, t)]
93angleTexts =
94    --  NAME         REPLACEMENT
95    [ o "cr"         "\r"
96    , o "crlf"       "\r\n"
97    , o "lf"         "\n"
98    , o "q"          "'"
99    , o "qq"         "\""
100    , o "sp"         " "
101    , o "tab"        "\t"
102    , o "dot"        "."
103    , o "comma"      ","
104    , o "colon"      ":"
105    , o "semicolon"  ";"
106    ] where o = (,)
107
108-- $Table
109--
110--  Some text literals are written
111--  using the following angle text.
112--
113--  [@\<cr\>@]      Carriage return
114--
115--  [@\<crlf\>@]    Carriage return and line feed
116--
117--  [@\<lf\>@]      Line feed
118--
119--  [@\<q\>@]       Single quote (@'@)
120--
121--  [@\<qq\>@]      Double quote (@\"@)
122--
123--  [@\<sp\>@]      Space
124--
125--  [@\<tab\>@]     Tab
126--
127
